var::Data Class Reference

Documentation

The Data storage class can be used to manage both statically and dyncamilly allocated data. The statically allocated data can be either read/write or read-only.

#include <sapi/var.hpp>
const char buffer_const[16];
char buffer[16];
Data empty; //the size of the data is zero. data_const() will return a pointer to a zero-length null-terminated string
Data data_dynamic(16); //this will dynamically allocate 16 bytes (see alloc())
Data data_static(buffer, 16); //will use buffer and consider it statically allocated (see set())
Data data_readonly(buffer_const, 16, true); //this will consider the data read only -- calls to data() will return 0
if( data_readonly.data() == 0 ){
printf("Data is read only\n"); //this will print
}
printf("This is empty data %s\n", empty.cdata_const()); //this is OK because empty data will return a valid string pointer

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

var::Data::Data ( )

Constructs a data object with no data

var::Data::Data ( void *  mem,
u32  size,
bool  readonly = false 
)

Constructs a data object with non-mutable data pointers (not memory managed)

Parameters
memA pointer to the data
sizeThe number of bytes available
readonlyIf true, the data will be accessible as read-only

The function does not manage the memory provided. The alloc() and free() methods will have no effect.

var::Data::Data ( u32  size)

Constructs data oject with dynamically allocated memory with size bytes (resizeable)

Parameters
sizeThe number of bytes to allocate
virtual var::Data::~Data ( )
virtual

Deconstructs a Data object.

This method will free any data that was allocated dynamically.

Member Function Documentation

int var::Data::alloc ( u32  size,
bool  resize = false 
)

Allocates (or reallocates) memory for the Data object.

Parameters
sizeThe number of bytes to allocate
resizeIf true, the old data is copied to the new data location
Returns
Zero If the operation was successful and -1 if it failed

If the memory was specified using the set() method or constructed as statically allocated memory, this will return an error.

virtual u32 var::Data::calc_size ( ) const
inlinevirtual

For top level data objects this is the same as capacity(). Other objects may re-implement to change how much user data is available. For example, Var::String will return the size of the string rather than the capacity of the data object

Returns
The number of bytes availabe in a data object
u32 var::Data::capacity ( ) const
inline

This method will return the current capcity of the data storage object.

Returns
Number of bytes in the data object
char* var::Data::cdata ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a char pointer to the data. This will return zero if the data is readonly.

See also
set()
const char* var::Data::cdata_const ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a pointer to const char data.

void var::Data::clear ( )

Write all zeros to the data. This will not attempt to write read-only data.

void* var::Data::data ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a pointer to the data. This will return zero if the data is readonly.

See also
set()
const void* var::Data::data_const ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a pointer to const data. This will return the memory pointer whether the memory is read-only or read-write.

void var::Data::fill ( unsigned char  d)

Fill the data with the specified value. This will not attempt to write read-only data.

Parameters
dThe value to write to the data
int var::Data::free ( )

Free the memory associated with this object. This will only perform any operations if the memory was dynamically allocating using this object.

Returns
static u32 var::Data::min_size ( )
static

Returns the minimum data storage size of any Data object.

int var::Data::resize ( u32  size)
inline

Resizes the data (equivalent to alloc()).

This is the same as alloc() with resize set to true

Parameters
sThe number of new bytes
Returns
Zero on success or -1 with errno set
void var::Data::set ( void *  mem,
u32  size,
bool  readonly = false 
)

Sets the storage object of the data. This object will treat the data as statically allocated and will not free the memory if free() is called or the object is destroyed.

Parameters
memA pointer to a fixed place in memory to use as storage
sizeThe number of bytes allocated
readonlytrue if readonly (used for data stored in flash)

If the memory is specified as read-only, data() will return 0 and data_const() will return a pointer to the memory.

If this object had previously allocated memory dynamically, the memory will be freed when this method is called.

int var::Data::set_capacity ( u32  s)

Sets the capacity of the data object.

Parameters
sThe number of minimum bytes needed
Returns
Zero on success

If the memory was specified using the set() method, this will return an error.

If the current capacity is less than s, the object will be resized. Otherwise, the data will
